title: Amid opt-out rumors, Sam Kennedy says Alex Bregman ‘wants to be here’ with Red Sox
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Alex Bregman can opt out of his three-year contract with the Red Sox after the 2025 season.
Red Sox President Sam Kennedy stated Bregman wishes to stay, dismissing recent opt-out rumors as surprising.
Bregman focuses on the season's end games, delaying any contract discussions until the offseason.

title: Bill Belichick says in new book that Tom Brady made ‘right decision’ to leave Patriots in 2020
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Bill Belichick admits Tom Brady made the right decision to leave the Patriots due to team's rebuilding phase.
Brady departed New England in 2020 and secured a Super Bowl with the Tampa Bay Buccaneers that same year.
Belichick points to financial constraints and poor draft picks as reasons for Patriots' decline post-Brady.

title: West Boylston town administrator fired after Trump flag dispute sues town
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Former West Boylston town administrator James Ryan sues town for $1.3 million over wrongful termination claims.
Ryan alleges firing was retaliation after demanding Police Chief Dennis Minnich remove a Trump flag from a public building.
Police Chief Minnich filed a complaint against Ryan, leading to a 4-1 vote by the Select Board to terminate him.

title: 18-year-old injured in R.I. after lighting himself on fire for TikTok challenge
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: An 18-year-old from North Smithfield, RI was hospitalized with severe burns after participating in a TikTok challenge.
The challenge involved setting himself on fire and jumping off a railroad trestle into Slatersville Reservoir.
A 16-year-old accomplice was unharmed; no trespassing charges filed despite the incident occurring on private property.

title: ‘Fear and uncertainty’: Everett officials cancel Hispanic Heritage Month festival amid ICE crackdown
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Everett cancels Fiesta Del Rio, scheduled for Sept. 20, due to recent ICE raids in the area.
Mayor Carlo DeMaria cited community fear and uncertainty as the reason for canceling the Hispanic Heritage Month event.
The event was planned to feature live music, art, and food from local Hispanic-owned businesses and organizations.

title: Josh Kraft ends mayoral campaign after coming in second by nearly 50 points in Tuesday’s preliminary
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Josh Kraft ended his mayoral campaign after losing to Mayor Michelle Wu by nearly 50 points in the preliminary election.
Kraft announced plans to donate $3 million to address the humanitarian crisis in the Massachusetts Avenue and Melnea Cass Boulevard area.
Kraft raised $6.8 million for his campaign, with $5.5 million of his own contributions, surpassing Wu's fundraising by $5 million.

title: Josh McDaniels defends Drake Maye: ‘He’s the right guy’ for Patriots
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Josh McDaniels defends Drake Maye after Patriots' Week 1 loss to Raiders, emphasizing long-term potential.
Maye completed 14 of 20 throws for 150 yards, but struggled with an interception in the second half.
McDaniels asserts the need for Maye to log more snaps and highlights focus on his development as a QB.

title: Authorities in a Connecticut town want to speak with whoever is painting the squirrels
author: Sana Muneer
bullets: Two squirrels in East Hartford, Connecticut, have been found painted red and blue, authorities report.
The painted squirrels were discovered near Naubuc Avenue and High Street, according to East Hartford Animal Control.
Authorities are seeking information from the public and working with a wildlife rehabilitator to aid the affected squirrels.

title: 2 Mass. teachers reportedly on leave for reactions to Charlie Kirk’s death
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Two Massachusetts teachers are on leave for social media posts about Charlie Kirk's death.
Police presence increased in Wachusett and Framingham districts following controversial posts by the teachers.
Charlie Kirk, aged 31 and founder of Turning Point USA, was shot at a Utah college event.

title: A top return from Bruins’ roster teardown, prospect Fraser Minten is looking to stick in NHL
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Fraser Minten, acquired from Toronto, aims for a spot on the Bruins 2025-26 NHL roster.
Boston overhauled its roster at the 2025 trade deadline, trading key players for picks and prospects.
Minten, praised for his maturity and reliability, is participating in the 2025 Prospects Challenge.
